isis.stitle: ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - TROUBLESHOOTING - BEGINNING THE TROUBLESHOOTING PROCESS

step1.para: When beginning the troubleshooting process, check for diagnostic codes using either:

step2.para: Or the Pro-Link 9000 Diagnostic Data Reader (DDR).

Record all information relating to the logged diagnostic codes. If using the Pro-Link, also note and record the number of occurrences for each code. If not using a Pro-Link, "Clear" all codes from memory.

step1.para: Test drive vehicle to confirm code or performance complaint.

step2.para: If the code is active after the test drive, refer to TROUBLESHOOTING WITH DIAGNOSTIC CODESfor the appropriate test procedure.

If the code is not "active" after the test drive, it may have been a momentary problem. If the diagnosis is being performed with the Pro-Link DDR, note the number of occurrences for the code. If the number of occurrences indicates that the code has been registered several times, perform the diagnostics for the diagnostic code and concentrate on problem areas that could create an intermittent condition.

step1.para: If diagnostic codes are present that are not covered in this manual, perform the checks identified in BEFORE BEGINNING TROUBLESHOOTING. If no defects are noted that resolve the condition, have an Allison dealer diagnose the vehicle.
